lexUnit.name: lively.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: full of life, energy, or activity.

sentence.text: The lovely town of Kandy is noted for the exquisite murals in the Dambulla rock temple , and the craft markets which stamp this town with a lively atmosphere .
Junior Chamber also provides the chance to make friends in a lively atmosphere and could be one of the reasons why the Aberdeen branch has approximately 75 members .
The atmosphere was not exactly lively but I continued to have lunch there for a long time because she was extremely kind and the food was good .
The Glasgow they evoke is a very hard and a very lively place .
Today it retains much of its charm and is a lively place full of good restaurants , cafés and pubs .
Roth got to know Bellow in Chicago , where Roth worked as a university teacher , finding it a lively place .
Set in the lively end of town , and new for Summer '90 , the attractive Magamar apartments are the place to be if you want to see as much motion as lotion !
At any rate , it would be a lively place !
An attractive resort with two picturesque marinas , a lovely cove of golden sand and a seaside lido , with lots of very lively bars and restaurants to visit in the evenings .

There are facilities for table tennis , football and bowls and , for a lively evening 's entertainment , there is a discotheque close by .
The Metropole features a large sun terrace , lounge , lively bar and restaurant .
It is a lively place in the evening too .
Night times are lively with ` happy hours " and regular barbecues , Turkish nights and party nights .
It is rarely spoken of as a lively city , and never as a promiscuous one .
Look round the lively and colourful capital of Argostoli and dine out in one of its many tavernas .
